file_content.text: You should have left me on Nathema.
You are my daughter. This is where you belong.
Do you know what they did to me there?
You needed discipline. You had to learn to control your power.
Those days are over. You're not Emperor anymore. Get over it.
Quit clinging to your past.
I do not long for what is past, yet the memories remain. You see them because our bond grows stronger.
Vaylin mentioned Nathema. What is that?
A blighted, forgotten world where the Force has been corrupted. I sent Vaylin there so she could learn... obedience.
Sounds fun. I'm sure Vaylin loved it.
Exactly what she needed.
It wasn't safe to send her anywhere else.
Unchecked, Vaylin was a threat to everything I had created... and to herself. Her power had to be contained.
You were scared of her.
I think you were afraid.
I respected her power. As should you. Do you not wonder why these memories are resurfacing now?
I figured you were trying to manipulate me somehow.
Feels like another trick.
This was a warning. She wants to break her conditioning.
If Vaylin unleashes her full power, even you may not be strong enough to stop her.
Still no word on where Vaylin's disappeared to.
Any chance she decided to give up on galactic conquest and retire to a quiet little colony on the Outer Rim?
I might know where she's gone. A planet called Nathema.
Scanning database // Nathema = planet in Chorlian Sector // Records = world deserted centuries ago
Hang on.
Someone sent an encrypted holocall to Vaylin during her little party. We traced the origin to that sector.
Why am I only hearing this now?
You should have told me.
The Chorlian Sector is huge! We don't have the resources to search every world.
I've heard stories of Nathema. Legend holds that the Force itself has been corrupted there.
If Vaylin's gone there, we have to follow.
We better check it out.
On it, Commander. I'll prep the shuttle. Meet me there when you're ready.
Stop playing games. If you have something to tell me, say it.
Enough riddles.
I did not cause this.
The bond between us is growing stronger. You are glimpsing my memories.
You caged her like an animal.
You imprisoned your own child.
A necessary sacrifice.
That's where she was conditioned. You sent her there to control her.
You wanted to break her will.
Instead of condemning me, you should ask why these memories are surfacing now.
Tell me what you know--now.
I'm not going to guess.
She may have found a way to break her conditioning.
That is not my sister's style.
I never thought to hear the name of that accursed world again.
You've been there?
Once. It's where Valkorion locked my sister away when she was a child. It's in the Chorlian Sector.
The message was important enough for Vaylin to drop everything and go.
There has to be a connection.
Nathema is a tainted world. If I go there, I fall back into my old ways.
Everything I have accomplished since being healed on Voss will be undone.
Stay here and watch over Senya. Lana, Theron--you're with me.
We can't take that risk.
Are you trying to tell me something?
Show yourself, Valkorion.
This was a memory, not a message. As our bond grows stronger, you glimpse scenes from my past.
No wonder your daughter hates you... and everyone else.
That's what drove Vaylin mad.
She learned to hate long before I sent her away.
If she was such a threat, you should have just killed her.
Why let her live, then?
She was still my daughter. In her, I saw aspects of myself. I hoped she could become worthy of the throne... she failed me.
Instead of focusing on the mistakes of my past, you should ask what this vision means for our future.
Are you saying Vaylin went back to Nathema?
Obviously it involves Vaylin.
She would only return if she had found a way to break her conditioning.
Vaylin has to know we're looking for her. Could she be luring us there for an ambush?
Any chance this is a trap?
We'll keep our guard up. But if this was a trap, she would've made it easier for us to follow.
Vaylin hated it there. She wouldn't return merely to set a trap.
It's times like these I'm glad I'm not Force-sensitive.
That won't bother me.
I shudder to imagine the damage if the Force has been corrupted over an entire planet. But we still need to investigate.
That would be catastrophic.
Do not take this lightly. If those stories are true, the entire planet will feel the effects.
Noted. But we're still going.
A legend to keep people away from the world. It won't work on me.
I'm not scared of stories.
If you're not ready to face your fears, you're no use to me.
If you're scared, stay behind.
I believe you're strong enough to do this, but I won't force you to go.
Don't doubt yourself.
It isn't cowardice that drives me. It's concern--for myself, and for all of you. You should go without me.
I'll go prep the shuttle.
Thank you, Outlander. I will stay and watch over Senya in case she wakes.
I know what it's like for someone else to control your every action while you can only watch. She'll do anything to break free.
I was brainwashed once.
Precisely. This vision is a warning: she must have found a way to break her conditioning. It's the only reason she would return to Nathema.
Roger that, Commander. I'll prep the shuttle. Meet me there when you're ready.
Nathema is a blighted, forgotten world where the Force has been corrupted. I sent Vaylin there to condition her mind... and teach her obedience.
That's where you taught her to "Kneel before the dragon of Zakuul."
The site of her brainwashing.
She left me no choice.
I sense something... Vaylin is drawn to Nathema once more.
The vision is a warning.
This is a sign. Vaylin may have returned to Nathema.
The vision is a warning.
We traced hundreds of calls during Vaylin's party. This one didn't raise any flags--until now.
Thank you. I will stay and watch over Senya in case she wakes.
Do you know what they did to me there?
You needed discipline. You had to learn to control your power.
The bond between us is growing stronger. You are glimpsing my memories.
Vaylin mentioned Nathema. What is that?
Nathema is a blighted, forgotten world where the Force has been corrupted. I sent Vaylin there to condition her mind... and teach her obedience.
That's where you taught her to "Kneel before the dragon of Zakuul."
The site of her brainwashing.
She left me no choice.
No wonder your daughter hates you... and everyone else.
That's what drove Vaylin mad.
She learned to hate long before I sent her away.
Sounds fun. I'm sure Vaylin loved it.
Exactly what she needed.
It wasn't safe to send her anywhere else.
Unchecked, Vaylin was a threat to everything I had created... and to herself. Her power had to be contained.
I sense something... Vaylin is drawn to Nathema once more.
The vision is a warning.
This is a sign. Vaylin may have returned to Nathema.
The vision is a warning.
You were scared of her.
I think you were afraid.

If she was such a threat, you should have just killed her.

She was still my daughter. In her, I saw aspects of myself. I hoped she could become worthy of the throne... she failed me.
Instead of focusing on the mistakes of my past, you should ask what this vision means for our future.

I figured you were trying to manipulate me somehow.

I'm not going to guess.

That is not my sister's style.
